snippet: A plan by officials in Aceh Province to ban women from straddling motorbikes has prompted an outcry from critics, who say leaders are infringing on women’s safety and freedom.
abstract: Plan by officials in Lhokseumawe, Indonesia, where Islamic law governs, to ban women from straddling motorbikes has prompted outcry from critics, who say local leaders are infringing on women's safety and freedom in name of religion.
lead_paragraph: A plan by officials in Aceh Province to ban women from straddling motorbikes has prompted an outcry from critics, who say leaders are infringing on women’s safety and freedom.

headline.seo: Indonesian City Wants to Ban Women From Straddling Motorbikes
headline.main: Indonesian Women Told How to Ride Motorbikes
headline.print_headline: Indonesian Women Told How to Ride Motorbikes
